snippet: A demand for suspended payments apparently sparked the attack on the office of Prime Minister Abdel Rahim el-Keeb, who reportedly was not present at the time.
abstract: Truckloads of armed men attack the Tripoli headquarters of Libya's interim Prime Min Abdel Rahim el-Keeb, who is reportedly away from the building; attacks demonstrate the lawlessness that is pervading the capital as national elections approach. (M)2
lead_paragraph: CAIRO -- Truckloads of armed men attacked the Tripoli headquarters of Libya's interim prime minister on Tuesday, in a new demonstration of the lawlessness pervading the capital just weeks before a scheduled national election. Officials of the interim Libyan government said that at least four people were killed, and news agencies reported that ambulances had rushed to the scene. The prime minister, Abdel Rahim el-Keeb, was reportedly away from the building at the time of the attack.

headline.main: Offices of Premier Attacked in Libya
